messages.messageBody:
>>Oh, I have enjoyed this group a lot, but I have way too many emails coming
>>in, and I am spending too much time reading them all, or even deleting
>>them all. I will check back another time with this list.>>

When I get overwhelmed by the volume, I just go on digest where you get 25
messages in one email. It's quicker and psychologically freeing. ;-)

>>In the meantime, I need to figure out HOW to unsubscribe from this
>>list?????>>

It's always at the bottom:

>To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
>Unschooling-dotcom-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com

Life is good.
~Mary

messages.messageBody:
Oh, I have enjoyed this group a lot, but I have way too many emails coming
in, and I am spending too much time reading them all, or even deleting them
all. I will check back another time with this list.

In the meantime, I need to figure out HOW to unsubscribe from this list?????

Thanks.

Debbie

messages.subject: Wons mor ooeeth feeleng
messages.msgSnippet: Our Strange Lingo: When the English tongue we speak. Why is break not rhymed with freak? Will you tell me why it s true We say sew but likewise few? And the
messages.messageBody:
Our Strange Lingo:

When the English tongue we speak.
Why is break not rhymed with freak?
Will you tell me why it's true
We say sew but likewise few?
And the maker of the verse,
Cannot rhyme his horse with worse?
Beard is not the same as heard
Cord is different from word.
Cow is cow but low is low
Shoe is never rhymed with foe.
Think of hose,dose,and lose
And think of goose and yet with choose
Think of comb,tomb and bomb,
Doll and roll or home and some.
Since pay is rhymed with say
Why not paid with said I pray?
Think of blood, food and good.
Mould is not pronounced like could.
Wherefore done, but gone and lone-
Is there any reason known?
To sum up all, it seems to me
Sound and letters don't agree.

Sent to senco-forum by Sheridan Sharp.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
